channel.title: Console based slot machine
channel.description:
So I was in Vegas for a bit and it inspired me to do this
nothing big

item.title: Console based slot machine
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I wouldn’t have complained either way, tbh. Unless you’re releasing a library or something a large number of people are going to use I dont care about your package prefix

Read full topic

item.title: Console based slot machine
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“Eyeownyew, post:5, topic:549382”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=668285.msg4469424#msg4469424 date=1422152546]

that is really excessive packaging for one class
i refuse to run it
[/quote]It is convention to have all of your applications to be packaged this way, actually. It helps people keep track of libraries and such by each developer having a unique prefix. Normally it’s your.website (for example a random google developer might use com.google.apps), but if you don’t have a website anything that distinguishes you works.

well that makes sense but for one class it seems extremely excessive[/quote]no it’s not, it’s good practice. only an inexperienced java developer would use the default package,

Read full topic

[quote=“Davidi2, post:4, topic:549382”][quote author=Eyeownyew link=topic=668285.msg4469415#msg4469415 date=1422149731]
that is really excessive packaging for one class
i refuse to run it
[/quote]It is convention to have all of your applications to be packaged this way, actually. It helps people keep track of libraries and such by each developer having a unique prefix. Normally it’s your.website (for example a random google developer might use com.google.apps), but if you don’t have a website anything that distinguishes you works.[/quote]
well that makes sense but for one class it seems extremely excessive
